content.location: The wide crack between Pinnacles 2 and 3.

climbs.name: Razor Tips
climbs.fa: (TR) Dave LePere, April 1999, FL: Brad Singer & John Cardmon, May 1999

content.description: The Main Pinnacle Ridge is located above the Skull formantion. From the meadow below to the south, hike up a climbers trail heading north and around the Skull's west side. Once on the backside of the Skull, continue north through faint trail networks the formations above (Pinnacles #1-6). Cross through a corridor (some scrambling required) and reach the north side of these pinnacles. Once there, the pinnacle are identifyed by looking at their north faces. Pinnacle #1 is the far left formation, then #2 is the next formation to the right, as are the remaining pinnacles.
content.protection:
Quickdraws!

- 4 bolts

- 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: The start of 'Razor Tips' is on the west face of Pinnacle #2. Start at the very bottom (the boulder in front of the face is OFF) and crimp your way up past 4 bolts. The crux is getting past the 1st bolt as one inches past balancy moves on thin edges. With more traffic, this route could be a better quality route.

content.description:
Starting from ground level climb a vertical face with thin edges into a prominent hand crack, then move right at the top to join Arrowsphere.

This would be a fun lead with the addition of a few bolts.
A face climb up a flake to a slab.
content.location: Face climb in the corridor between Pinnacles 1 and 2.

content.description: The Main Pinnacle Ridge is located above the Skull formantion. From the meadow below to the south, hike up a climbers trail heading north and around the Skull's west side. Once on the backside of the Skull, continue north through faint trail networks the formations above (Pinnacles #1-6). Cross through a corridor (some scrambling required) and reach the north side of these pinnacles. Once there, the pinnacle are identifyed by looking at their north faces. Pinnacle #1 is the far left formation, then #2 is the next formation to the right, as are the remaining pinnacles. Arrowsphere is located on the right side arete of the north face of Pinnacle #2. As a side note, there is an excellent 3 bolt route on the left arete of Pinnacle #2, checking in at .10b (unknown FA and route name, probably put up by Pat Brennan).
content.protection:
-4 bolts

-2 bolt anchor with chains (on the top most part of the summit of the pinnacle)
content.location: Start on the boulder next to the base of an arete. Clip the first bolt and launch up the arete, clipping 3 more bolts to the top. Fairly straight forward.

climbs.name: Loose Stool
climbs.fa: Kenn Kenaga, Pat Brennan, Bob Cable, Eric Tipton 11-98

content.description: A wide crack to the top of the formation.
content.location: The wide crack in the corridor between Pinnacle 1 and 2.
